q:
Anita is building placeholder cards for testimonials using HTML and CSS with standard styling. Currently, all cards are aligned side by side. She wants to make them responsive by showing 2 columns in tablet view and 1 column in mobile view using CSS. Then which of the following Media Queries can Anita add to achieve the mentioned requirements.

HTML Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
    <style>
      * {
        box-sizing: border-box;
      }

      .card {
        float: left;
        width: 25%;
        padding: 20px;
      }

      .row:after {
        content: "";
        display: table;
        clear: both;
      }
    </style>
  </head>

  <body>
    <h2>Cards Demo</h2>

    <div class="row">
      <div class="card">
        <h2>Card 1</h2>
        <p>Caption</p>
      </div>

      <div class="card">
        <h2>Card 2</h2>
        <p>Caption</p>
      </div>

      <div class="card">
        <h2>Card 3</h2>
        <p>Caption</p>
      </div>

      <div class="card">
        <h2>Card 4</h2>
        <p>Caption</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </body>
</html>

Options

1.

@media screen and (min-width: 600px) {
   .card {
      width: 50%;
   }
}

@media screen and (min-width: 992px) {
    .card {
       width: 100%;
    }
}

2.

@media screen and (max-width: 992px) {
   .card {
      width: 50%;
   }
}

@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
    .card {
       width: 100%;
    }
}

3.

@media screen and (min-width: 992px) {
   .card {
      width: 50%;
   }
}

@media screen and (min-width: 600px) {
    .card {
       width: 100%;
    }
}

4.

@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
   .card {
      width: 50%;
   }
}

@media screen and (max-width: 992px) {
    .card {
       width: 100%;
    }
}
